odoo.data:
Inventory Test general one_page
60 scoring_without_answers 80.0 open
1. Safety stock + EOQ is equal to : simple_choice
A. Average inventory
0.0
B. Normal maximum inventory
3.33
C. Absolute maximum inventory
0.0
D. Order point
0.0
2. The name for an order size that minimizes inventory ordering and carrying costs is: simple_choice
A. Order point
0.0
B. Safety stock
0.0
C. EQO
0.0
D. EOQ
3.33
3. Which one of the following is not an ordering cost? simple_choice
A. Clerical and administrative costs of purchasing, accounting, and goods reception
0.0
B. Transportation costs
0.0
C. Unloading costs
0.0
D. None of the above
3.33
4. Which one of the following is not a carrying cost? simple_choice
A. Storage charges (rent, lighting, heating, etc.)
0.0
B. Material handling costs
0.0
C. Stores staffing, equipment, maintenance and running costs
0.0
D. Transportation costs
3.33
5. Extra inventory carried to serve as insurance against fluctuations in demand is called : simple_choice
A. EOQ
0.0
B. Ordering point
3.33
C. Wastage inventory
0.0
D. Safety stock
0.0
6. Boomerang Ltd. had 200 units in its inventory on 30 November valued at $800. In December, it made the purchases and sales shown in the table below simple_choice
Using FIFO, which of the following is the inventory valuation?
A. $4,460
3.33
B. $4,340
0.0
C. $4,620
0.0
D. $3,500
0.0
7. The following information relates to Camberwell's year-end inventory of finished goods. simple_choice
At what amount should the finished goods inventory be stated in the company's statement of financial position?
A. $13,280
0.0
B. $18,960
0.0
C. $19,580
3.33
D. $18,760
0.0
8. At its year-end, Crocodile Ltd. has 600 items of product A and 2,000 of product B, costing $10 and $5, respectively. The following information is available: 500 items of product A are defective and can only be sold at $8 each; 100 items of product B are to be sold for $4.50 each with selling expenses of $1.50 each. What figure should appear in Crocodile's statement of financial position for the inventory? simple_choice
A. $57,000
0.0
B. $68,950
0.0
C. $68,800
3.33
D. $70,000
0.0
9. In a period of rising prices, the FIFO method of charging inventory issues to production will show a lower gross profit figure compared to the AVCO method. simple_choice
A. True
0.0
B. False
3.33
10. Your firm's inventory valuation method is AVCO. On 1 June, there were 60 units in the inventory valued at $12 each. On 8 June, 40 units were purchased for $15 each and a further 50 units were purchased for $18 each on 14 June. On 21 June, 78 units were sold for $20 each. What is the value of the closing inventory on 30 June? simple_choice
A. $1,110
3.33
B. $1,010
0.0
C. $900
0.0
D. $1,125
0.0
11. Extra inventory carried to serve as insurance against fluctuations in demand is called : simple_choice
A. Wastage Inventory
0.0
B. Safety stock
3.33
C. Ordering point
0.0
D. Minimum level
0.0
12. items of product B are to be sold for $4.50 each with selling expenses of $1.50 each. What figure should appear in Crocodile's statement of financial position for the inventory? simple_choice
A. $57,000
0.0
B. $68,950
0.0
C. $68,800
3.33
D. $70,000
0.0
13. To achieve ___ in purchasing and transportation, goods may be purchased in larger quantities than the actual demand. simple_choice
A. Cost efficiency
3.33
B. Potencial value
0.0
C. Continuation
0.0
D. Quality
0.0
14. Effective inventory management minimizes the investment in inventory by effectively meeting the ___. simple_choice
A. Customer requirement
0.0
B. Functional requirement
3.33
C. Process reliability
0.0
D. Sales forecasting of a firm
0.0
15. Which of the following models is used to calculate the timing of the inventory order? simple_choice
A. Economic order quantity model
0.0
B. Fixed order quantity model
0.0
C. Fixed order inventory model
3.33
D. Reorder point model
0.0
16. In the ABC Analysis system the B category stands for___. simple_choice
A. Comparatively unimportant in value
0.0
B. Outstanding importance in value
0.0
C. Finished goods inventory me
0.0
D. Average importance in value
3.33
17. Which among the following is a quantity of a specific item that is ordered from the supplier and issued as a standard quantity to the production process? simple_choice
A. Lot size
3.33
B. Standard deviation
0.0
C. Inventory control
0.0
D. Safety stock
0.0
18. The economic order quantity formula is taken using ___. simple_choice
A. Integral calculus
0.0
B. Vector calculus
0.0
C. Multivariate analysis
0.0
D. Differential calculus
3.33
19. Which among the following components is calculated as the sum of the fixed costs that happen each time an item is ordered? simple_choice
A. Carrying cost
0.0
B. Order cost
3.33
C. Holding cost
0.0
D. Storing cost
0.0
20. The price reductions offered to customers for large orders, to encourage them to purchase in large quantities is known as ___. simple_choice
A. Freebies
0.0
B. Quantity discounts
3.33
C. Normal discounts
0.0
D. Premiums
0.0
21. A company that maintains a sufficient safety margin by having extra inventory against certain situations is termed as ___. simple_choice
A. Tinventory
0.0
B. lot size
0.0
C. safety stock
3.33
D. lead
0.0
22. Identify the mode of production that is widely used in a production model and in the assembly operations? simple_choice
A. Round-robin mode
0.0
B. Batch mode
3.33
C. Grid mode
0.0
D. Parallel mode
0.0
23. Which among the following costs is the expense of storing inventory for a specified period of time? simple_choice
A. Purchasing cost
0.0
B. Carrying cost
3.33
C. Financial cost
0.0
D. Storing cost
0.0
24. Which of the following is the ratio of net profit to net sales? simple_choice
.
A. Net Operating ratio
0.0
B. Gross profit ratio
0.0
C. Pretax Profit ratio
0.0
D. Net profit ratio
3.33
25. A method that uses a predetermined overhead rate to allocate overhead costs is known as ___. simple_choice
A. Plant-wide allocation
3.33
B. Shipping allocation
0.0
C. Department allocation
0.0
D. Production-wide allocation
0.0
26. Which of the following costs is estimated by multiplying the quantity determined in the bill of materials to the cost of each component? simple_choice
A. Operating
0.0
B. Production
0.0
C. Labour
0.0
D. Material
3.33
27. A long-term solvency or leverage ratio is called ___. simple_choice
A. Net profit ratio
0.0
B. Proprietary ratio
3.33
C. Activity ratio
0.0
D. Stock turnover ratio
0.0
28. Which among the following systems provides a process that enables one to track product movement throughout the company? simple_choice
A. Item tracker system
0.0
B. Product locator system
3.33
C. Memory locator system
0.0
D. Real-time locator system
0.0
29. Identify the system that allows you to have strong control over items without necessarily updating the location records? simple_choice
A. Zoning systems
0.0
B. Fixed locator system
3.33
C. Zone locator system
0.0
D. Combining system
0.0
30. Manufacturers actually print the labels provided to them and serial numbers to aid in ___. simple_choice
A. Quality audit
0.0
B. Quality control
3.43
